This is simple wrapper for the installation process of the Xcode CommandLine Tools.
You can either use this for installation or the normal way.


This item will not notify you of future updates.

#!/usr/local/munki/munki-python
# REQUIRED LIBRARIES import subprocess, os from time import sleep from sys import path path.append('/usr/local/munki') from munkilib.processes import stop_requested from munkilib.display import display_status_minor, display_percent_done, display_error
def quit_error(msg: str): # Remove the installer state try: os.remove("/tmp/.com.apple.dt.CommandLineTools.installondemand.in-progress") except: pass
display_error(msg) display_status_minor(msg) sleep(5) exit(1)
# Prepare download open('/tmp/.com.apple.dt.CommandLineTools.installondemand.in-progress', 'a').close()
# Get the correct item name display_status_minor('Scanning for installer ') scan_result = subprocess.run(['/usr/sbin/softwareupdate', '-l'], stdout=subprocess.PIPE).stdout.decode().split('\n') command_line_tools = [item for item in scan_result if 'Label:' in item and 'Command Line Tools' in item ][0].split(': ')[1].strip()
if not command_line_tools: quit_error('Could not find suitable installer via SoftwareUpdate')
# DOWNLOAD THE OS FROM APPLE CDN display_status_minor('Download started ') download = subprocess.Popen( ['/usr/bin/script', '-q', '/dev/null', '/usr/sbin/softwareupdate', '--install', command_line_tools], bufsize=0, universal_newlines=True, stdout=subprocess.PIPE )
skip_lines = ['Software Update Tool', 'Finding available software']
while download.poll() is None: if stop_requested(): download.kill() quit_error("User stopped download")
line = download.stdout.readline()
if line is None or line.strip() == "" or line.strip() in skip_lines: continue
display_status_minor(line)
if download.returncode != 0: quit_error('Installation of ' + command_line_tools + ' failed.')
# Remove the installer state try: os.remove("/tmp/.com.apple.dt.CommandLineTools.installondemand.in-progress") except: pass
exit(0)
